q2.question: Where did Gollum lead Sam and Frodo through?

q4.question: Why did Gollum stop Frodo and Sam at the black gate?
q4.answer: ['he knew a different path which was better']
q4.recall: Gollum stopped Frodo and Sam at the Black Gate because he revealed a safer path for them to take.
q4.vectordb: Gollum stopped Frodo and Sam at the black gate because he revealed a less risky path to them. Sam remained distrustful, but Frodo gave him the benefit of the doubt and began calling him Sméagol. While observing the gate, the rocky ledge on which Sam lay gave way and he tumbled down the cliff. Frodo rushed to help him and, in desperation, threw the cloak given to him by Galadriel over them both.
q4.hybrid: Gollum stopped Frodo and Sam at the black gate because he revealed a less risky path to them. Sam remained distrustful, but Frodo gave him the benefit of the doubt and began calling him Sméagol. While observing the gate, the rocky ledge on which Sam lay gave way and he tumbled down the cliff. Frodo rushed to help him and, in desperation, threw the cloak given to him by Galadriel over them both.
